result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Javier Sheldrick appeared by video.  Attorney Matt Last in court for Javier Sheldrick.  Attorney Jessica Ann Behling appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a DPA review hearing.  Defendant has completed all conditions. Case is adjourned to 1-30-23 at 8:30 am for a final review hearing by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Review hearing scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Javier Sheldrick in court with attorney Matt Last.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Javier Sheldrick appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.

  Review hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Deferred Prosecution Agreement
Received and Filed. Elements of the Offense
Received and Filed. Addendum to Plea Questionnaire

Defendant Javier Sheldrick in court with attorney Matt Last.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Javier Sheldrick appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense counsel requests DPA Hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 10:
Defendant Javier Sheldrick in court with Attorney Matt Last.  Jessica Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: South Milwaukee Officer N. Siefert.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SS, MS, or KK except as permitted by any family or juvenile court orders.

Defendant Javier Sheldrick in court with attorney Matt Last.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 10.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/22/22 @ 1p
